DKeep.logic

Class Suspicious

  • java.lang.Object
    • DKeep.logic.Character
      • DKeep.logic.Guard
        • DKeep.logic.Suspicious

  • public class Suspicious
extends Guard
    Class Suspicious - Character -> Guard -> Suspicious Type of guard. Which stops randomly and changes direction.
    Since:
    2018-04-02
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    André Esteves && Luís Diogo Silva

    • Field Detail

      • direction

        boolean direction
        Direction of the Suspicious Guard. Can be true, normal path, or false, inverted path.

      • modifier

        float modifier
        Value of the initial probability of the Suspicious Guard stop. Standard value is float(1/3).

      • indice

        int indice
        Indice of the Suspicious Guard on his path. Initial value when created is 0.

      • path

        char[] path
        Path of the Suspicious Guard. Array of Char's. Meaning: 'l' - left. 'd' - down. 'r' - right. 'u' - up.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Suspicious

        public Suspicious(int x,
                  int y)
        Creates a new Suspicious Guard with the given position, x and y.
        Parameters:
        x - X position.
        y - Y position.

      • Suspicious

        public Suspicious(int x,
                  int y,
                  boolean dir,
                  float mod,
                  int ind)
        Creates a new Suspicious Guard with the given position, x and y, direction, modifier, indice.
        Parameters:
        x - X position.
        y - Y position.
        dir - direction of the Guard.
        mod - modifier, probability of fall asleep.
        ind - indice on Suspicious path.

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(char[][] map)
        Moves the Guard in the respective given map. Respecting the logic of the game.
        Overrides:
        move in class Guard
        Parameters:
        map - char[][] Map to be set.

      • checkChangeDirection

        private void checkChangeDirection()
        Increments modifier by 1/3. If the value set in this function is greater or equal than 0.8 the Guard changes direction.

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame(java.io.BufferedWriter writer)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the information of the Guard.
        Overrides:
        saveGame in class Guard
        Parameters:
        writer - BufferedWriter writer to be set with the respective info.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws exception if fails on writing.
